page.title: 17BLO'NORTON CHURCH.
page.content: There has been a church on the site of St. Andrew's Church, Blo'Norton since before the Domesday Book of 1087 although no part of the present building is that old, dating as it does from the 13th century. The church fabric is not in a good state of {REPAIR,}the tower being unsafe and the bells thus inoperative. Money is available for repairs and work is due to start in 1986. A true community spirit is not helped by the scattered nature of the parish but members take an active part in the social activities of the village. There is a weekly service and regular{UNITED SERVICES}with adjacent Garboldisham Church. The church has been associated in the past with{PRINCE}Frederick Duleep Singh who lived for some time at the Hall and is buried in the Churchyard.
